overview: â€¢ Co-founder and Partner Europe in 2008 of Digitalents Capital, focused on late stage ecommerce and online financial services for US and Chinese companies looking to expand in Europe. â€¢ Closely involved, from 2006 onward, with the foundation of pan-European and Chinese sport-fashion-lifestyle market place Born.com with founder and CEO Mr Jean-Christophe Chopin (co-founder of E*Trade Europe, co-founder of Wifirst, co-founder and Chairman of Digitalents Capital) in charge of overall business development across Europe with large Internet/ Media partners such as Lâ€™Equipe in France, Premiere TV in Germany, Wayn.com in UK and Neteller across Europe. â€¢ Business development and restructuring of digital businesses in France, UK and Germany from 2001 to 2005 and ongoing portfolio monitoring of 8 companies for Mr Jean-Christophe Chopin family holding in the digital space. Exited successfully 3 investments: IAG Research / Rewardtv.com in the US sold to Nielsen for $225M, Wifirst and Assuronline.com in France. â€¢ Financial Analyst at Goldman Sachs London in 1997 focusing on digital businesses in the Equity Capital Market team. Moved to New-York with Goldman Sachs in 1999 to focus on M&A operations in digital sector such as AOL/Time Warner merger, eBay secondary offerings and Yahoo acquisition opportunities. Licensed by the FSA and NYSE Series 7. â€¢ Graduated from Paris Dauphine University in 1997 with a Master in Economy and Finance.
